text: Cilix filipjevi is a moth in the family Drepanidae first described by Nikolai Ivanovich Kardakoff in 1928. It is found in the Russian Far East (Ussuri), Korea, north-eastern China and Japan. ==Subspecies== *Cilix filipjevi filipjevi (Russia: Ussuri, Korea, north-eastern China: Manchuria) *Cilix filipjevi malivora Inoue, 1958 (Japan) ==References== Category:Moths described in 1928 Category:Drepaninae
title: Cilix filipjevi
